title.narrative: Maurice - Renforcement des capacités statistiques (SCB II) dans les pays membres de la région pour le suivi et l’évaluation des résultats des OMD
Mauritius - Statistical Capacity Building (SCB II) in regional member countries for MDG monitoring & results measurement

description.narrative: Les principaux bénéficiaires du programme sont les ministères, les départements et agences du gouvernement ; les institutions académique ; la société civile ; les ONG, les organisations multilatérales et autres organisations internationales ainsi que le secteur privé.

The main beneficiaries of the programme are Government Ministries, Departments and Agencies; Academic Institutions; Civil Society; NGOs, Multilateral and other International Organizations; and the Private Sector.

Les principaux objectifs du programme sont de renforcer les capacités statistiques de Statistics Mauritius afin d'améliorer la formulation des politiques, la prise de décision, l’efficacité de la mesure des résultats et la diffusion des indicateurs critiques, notamment en ce qui concerne la pauvreté et les OMD.

The main objectives of the program are to build statistical capacity of Statistics Mauritius in order to improve policy formulation, decision making, effective results measurement, and dissemination of critical indicators including for poverty and the MDGs.

La présente intervention est relative au don du Fonds d’assistance technique pour les pays à revenu intermédiaire (FAT-PRI) pour le renforcement des capacités statistiques (SCB II) dans les pays membres de la région pour le suivi et l’évaluation des résultats des OMD. Ce programme devrait permettre à Statistics Mauritius d'améliorer la coordination de l'ensemble du système statistique national afin de fournir des données fiables, pertinentes, cohérentes et à jour. Cela contribuerait à assurer une gestion économique plus efficace, à mieux poursuivre les objectifs du millénaire pour le développement (OMD) et les objectifs de développement durable (ODD), à mieux appréhender la pauvreté, à élaborer des politiques éclairées et fondées sur la réalité, ainsi qu’à améliorer la conception des futurs programmes et projets de la Banque. En stimulant les capacités statistiques à Maurice, le programme devait contribuer à accroître la capacité du personnel du SSN à entreprendre la conception et la préparation des projets et programmes, à mener diverses études de faisabilité et sectorielles ainsi que d’autres études à l’échelle du pays. Le programme comporte quatre composantes principales : (i) l‘appui aux activités actuelles du SSN ; (ii) l’amélioration des statistiques sociales et le suivi et l’analyse de la pauvreté, (iii) l’amélioration des statistiques dans les domaines prioritaires (infrastructures, 7 égalité de genre, agriculture et gouvernance) ; (iv) le développement, l’archivage et la diffusion des données.

The present intervention relates to the Middle Income Countries Technical Assistance Fund (MIC-TAF) grant for Statistical Capacity Building (SCB II) in regional member countries for MDG monitoring & results measurement. This programme should help to enable Statistics Mauritius to improve coordination of the overall National Statistical System in order to provide reliable, relevant, coherent and timely data. This would contribute to more effective economic management, better MDGs/SDGs and poverty monitoring, informed evidencebased policy making as well as to contributing to improvements in the design of future Bank programs and projects. By strengthening statistical capacity in Mauritius, the program would contribute to increasing the capacity of the NSS staff to undertake project/program design and preparation, various feasibility and sector studies, and other country analytical work. The program has four main components: (i) support current activities of the NSS, (ii) improving social statistics, poverty monitoring and analysis, (iii) improving statistics in priority focus areas (infrastructure, gender, agriculture, and governance), (iv) data development, archiving and dissemination.

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

description.narrative: Total Disbursement in First Quarter of 2015
Total Disbursement in Third Quarter of 2012

target.value: Enhance data management and dissemination systems at Statistics Mauritius (SM)

actual.value: 2 servers purchased and installed; 43 tablets purchased and are used for survey data collection-Data Portal and Open Data Portal installed and running; and staff trained

target.value: Collection of data for the regional AIKP program to support computation of regional infrastructure indicators; Conduct a national workshop to disseminate the results

actual.value: Data collected on all infrastructure sectors and submitted to AfDB

title.narrative: Build capacity of staff of the National Statistical System (NSS)

target.value: Statistical capacity of data producers and users strengthened; and both Producers and Users sensitized on the use of statistics for policy making

actual.value: Hands on training provided to staff of SM. Producers and Users and statistics sensitized on the use of statistics for policy making

title.narrative: Timeliness for production of critical statistical outputs is improved

actual.value: Over 100 statistical publications produced each year

title.narrative: International Comparison Program (ICP) - National Accounts and Prices Statistics

target.value: At the global level, it is agreed that ICP should be apermanent statistical endeavour; mainstreamed within the National Statistical Office (NSO) annual programming and Purchasing Power Parities should be produced every year. Ideally, ICP National Accounts Special Surveys should be undertaken annually to support continuous improvement in National Accounts & Price Statistics; and GDP Rebasing and complete migration to System of National Accounts (SNA) 2008

actual.value: Price data collection for ICP 2011 & ICP pilot for 2015/16 were collected and submitted for computation of Price levels and PPPs. Expenditure on GDP breakdown done and submitted. Began migration to SNA 2008 after GDP rebasing using HBS 2012

title.narrative: Creation of a computerized Central Business Register

target.value: Implement all Stages 1-8 of planned program on Statistical Business Register (SBR)

title.narrative: Statistical databases for policy makers and regional comparison are available on-line in downloadable formats

actual.value: Statistical infrastructure in place is improved with the development of Statistical Business Register (SBR), Open Data Portal (ODP)

title.narrative: Increased reliability of national poverty and other socioeconomic statistics for policy purposes

target.value: Regular production of national poverty and other socioeconomic statistics to inform public policy and economic management

actual.value: Sustained undertaking of the Household Budget Survey every 5 years); production of Labour Force, Employment and Unemployment data; Continued update of the SBR for data management of socioeconomic data; and a new & dynamic Government Open Data System

title.narrative: An effective National Statistical System (NSS) meeting the data needs of Mauritius

target.value: A strong NSS guided by a strong National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS) and legal instruments for effective coordination

actual.value: There is a strong Statistics Act in place, which has enabled Statistics Mauritius to effectively coordinate the national statistical system and access administrative data from other agencies in Government and private sector

title.narrative: Availability of data for regional comparison (ICP, AIKP, HCPI, etc.)
